snippet: Increases in private sector spending — not federal expenditures — have bolstered the nation’s slow-but-sure rebound from the recession.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column holds the economic recovery that has followed the end of the 2007-9 recession may be properly named the private enterprise bounce; states while the overall recovery is comparable to recoveries after the two previous recessions, this one has been pushed higher by rising private investment and hiring, but held back by cuts in government spending and hiring.
lead_paragraph: Increases in private sector spending — not federal expenditures — have bolstered the nation’s slow-but-sure rebound from the recession.

headline.print_headline: A Recovery With Business Stepping Out in Front
headline.seo: A Recovery With Business Out Front - Off the Charts
headline.main: A Recovery With Business Stepping Out in Front
